alex.mojaki.boxes.observers.change

Class ThrowOnNull

  • java.lang.Object
    • alex.mojaki.boxes.observers.change.ThrowOnNull
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChangeObserver

    public class ThrowOnNull
extends Object
implements ChangeObserver
    Throws an IllegalArgumentException when the value changes to null.

    Note that all boxes start with a null value, and adding this does not affect that. It will only throw an exception when you explicitly set null as the value.

    You can't create a new instance of this class. Use the public constant I, or INSTANCE if you prefer.

    • Method Detail

      • onChange

        public void onChange(PowerBox box,
                     Object originalValue,
                     Object finalValue,
                     Object requestedValue)
        Description copied from interface: ChangeObserver
        Take some action based on the values involved in the change. Called when the value of a PowerBox changes for zero or more of these objects.
        Specified by:
        onChange in interface ChangeObserver
        Parameters:
        box - the PowerBox whose value changed.
        originalValue - the value the box contained before the change.
        finalValue - the new value the box will have. In the case of PowerBox.set(Object), this is the final result of applying all ChangeMiddleware.
        requestedValue - the parameter of PowerBox.set(Object), or just the same as originalValue in the case of a mutation to a WrapperBox.
